required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Assess Safety, Tolerability and Clinical Activity of BGB-290 in Combination With Temozolomide (TMZ) in Participants With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1b Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability and Clinical Activity of BGB-290 in Combination With Temozolomide (TMZ) in Subjects With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to determine the safety and tolerability of pamiparib, the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) or maximum administered dose (MAD) for pamiparib combined with TMZ, to select the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D) and schedule of pamiparib in combination with TMZ, and to determine the antitumor activity of pamiparib in combination with TMZ.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and nature of dose limiting toxicities (DLTs) as assessed by CTCAE.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose BGB-290 and TMZ to 28 days post-dosing

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants experiencing Adverse Events (AEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose BGB-290 and TMZ to 30 days post-dosing

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants experiencing Severe Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose BGB-290 and TMZ to 30 days post-dosing
From first dose BGB-290 and TMZ to first documentation of disease progression, assessed up to 5 years

secondary_outcome.measure: maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) of BGB-290 and TMZ.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose BGB-290 and TMZ to 30 days post-dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: lowest concentration reached before the next dose administered (Ctrough) of BGB-290 and TMZ.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose BGB-290 and TMZ to 30 days post-dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: time to reach maximum (peak) plasma concentration (Tmax) of BGB-290 and TMZ.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose BGB-290 and TMZ to 30 days post-dosing
From first dose BGB-290 and TMZ to first documentation of disease progression, assessed up to 5 years
From first dose BGB-290 and TMZ to first documentation of disease progression while participant is alive, assessed to up 5 years
From first dose BGB-290 and TMZ to first documentation of disease progression or death, whichever is first, assessed up to 5 years
From first dose BGB-290 and TMZ until date of death, assessed up to 5 years

clinical_study.condition: Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm A (Dose Escalation) TMZ Pulse Dosing
arm_group.description: Participants receive continuous BGB-290 and escalating flat doses of 40mg, 80mg, 100mg, 120mg (as 20 mg capsules) daily administered orally up to the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of TMZ on Days 1 - 7 of a 28-day cycle.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm B (Dose Escalation) TMZ Continuous Dosing
arm_group.description: Participants receive continuous BGB-290 and escalating flat doses of 40mg, 80mg, 100mg, 120mg (as 20 mg capsules) daily administered orally up to the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of TMZ on Days 1 - 28 of a 28-day cycle.
Participants receive continuous BGB-290 and TMZ at the recommended phase 2 dose (RP2D) and schedule in 28 day cycles

intervention.description: 60 mg (20 mg capsules) administered orally twice a day
intervention.arm_group_label: Arm A (Dose Escalation) TMZ Pulse Dosing
Arm B (Dose Escalation) TMZ Continuous Dosing

intervention.description: Doses of up to 120 mg (as 20 mg capsules) administered orally once daily (QD) as specified in the treatment arm
intervention.arm_group_label: Arm A (Dose Escalation) TMZ Pulse Dosing
Arm B (Dose Escalation) TMZ Continuous Dosing

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age ≥18 years old with advanced or metastatic stage solid tumors
2. Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) status ≤ 1 and measurable disease per RECIST V1.1 (except for participants in dose escalation and prostate cancer participants)
3. Additional inclusion criteria for dose expansion cohorts:
Participants with homologous recombination deficiency (HRD+) or known BRCA mutant Ovarian cancer
a. Previously received at least 1 line of platinum containing chemotherapy and No progression or recurrent disease in 6 months from last platinum containing regimen. Participants with HRD+ or known breast cancer susceptibility gene (BRCA) mutant Triple-Negative Breast Cancer
a. 0 - 1 prior platinum-containing regimen (any treatment setting) and received ≤ 3 prior regimens (advanced or metastatic setting).
Participants with HRD+ or known BRCA mutant Prostate cancer
1. Chemotherapy-naïve or previously received ≤2 taxane-based regimens.
2. May have pre-or post-treatment with a novel androgen receptor targeted agent. Participants Small cell lung and gastric cancer
a. Previously received ≤ 2 prior lines of therapy. Participants with HRD+ NSCLC, head and neck cancer, esophageal cancer and soft tissue sarcomas
1. Must have tumors with with HRD+ as centrally determined
2. Must have received at least 1 but not more than 3 prior lines of therapy.
Treatment naïve patients with soft tissue sarcoma might be allowed if standard of care therapy is not suitable or available.
Key Exclusion Criteria: All participants
1. Prior exposure to a poly adenosine diphosphate-ribose polymerase (PARP) inhibitor.
2. Refractory to platinum-based therapy.
NOTE: Other protocol defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply.

facility.name: University of Texas- MD Anderson Cancer Center
Hospital Universitario Virgen de la Macarena
Sir Bobby Robson Cancer Trials Research Centre
Beatson West of Scotland Cancer Centre
